newsitem.title: CHINA: China air transport growth seen world's fastest.
newsitem.headline: China air transport growth seen world's fastest.

text.p: China's air transport is expected to show the highest growth rate in the world of 10 percent annually, over the next two decades, the Xinhua news agency said quoted a report by Airbus Industrie as saying.
China expects to have a fleet of 1,000 planes by the year 2000, and is buying an average of 30 foreign airliners a year, Xinhua said.
China was expected to buy 38 airliners this year, it said.
The airline industry has been one of the fastest growing sectors in China's economy since the launch of economic reforms 19 years ago, Xinhua said.
Air traffic averaged an average annual increase of 16.3 percent from 1994 to 1996, it said quoting the Civil Aviation Administration of China (CAAC).
Last year, Chinese airlines carried 55.51 million passengers and had an overall transport volume of 8.05 billion tonne-km, it said.
CAAC was looking for annual growth of 13 percent for the airline industry by 2000, with 80 million passengers, and a transport volume of 12 billion tonne-km, it said.
